div.p: From Joseph Hooker to Henry Barkly
RBG Kew, Archives, Letters from Joseph Hooker vol. 1: ADA-BAR, ff. 196-8.

Only sections relevant to M have been transcribed. No. 13
All letters to Barkly are numbered in chronological order. The document is purple typescript or carbon copy, though not marked 'copy'.

My annoyances from Mr Ayrton are but just over for the moment. The outrageous statements he made in the house have further complicated matters — there are just 11 untruths in his speech […] I shall have to print, for private distribution, a short statement of the latest phase of the affair.

I fear this is a very incoherent letter. I write from Mr. Darwin's house, where I am staying for a few days with Mrs. Hooker and one of my little boys, who is in agonies from a whitlow, and by whose side I write.Poor Mueller is still in agonies, and I have written a strong letter, condemning the proposal of appointing an independent decorator of his Garden […]
Letter not found.
